@sevilalucard
Are you even serious? We do have homeless people, but they aren't currently covered in rubble.  Our poorest person is still better off than 95% of Haiti, minus those who make a crapload off the tourism and don't do much for their local economy otherwise.  At least ours can get to shelters and foodbanks.  I would understand if our new Cause of the Week was just a random 3rd World country, but there was a real disaster that happened there.  I'm assuming you believed that New Orleans deserved it too.  I'm sorry for adding more unrelated posts to the comment sections, but people I know that you can all act bigger and badder when you're hiding behind your computer screens but try a little compassion.  Whether you like something or a certain people or not, nobody should have to go through the things that are going on over there.

@Hunterdad
The Baptist's were still in the wrong, so as long as the courts are handling everything correctly then it should be alright.  I understand they were trying to help but to take children out of the country without any kind of documentation is obviously going to cause trouble.  If a Baptist Missionary took a single American child out of a Wal-Mart he'd be arrested and probably sentenced to a heavy sentence.  You can't take fruit across a national border half the time, how did they expect that there'd be no problems taking a busload of kids over.  I don't think they were trying to do anything evil or anything like that, but it seems like nobody had any common sense there.

Thank you for the upload! The qualty is acceptable but really looking forward to the DVD release. We saw the movie on the big screen and it was the best film Mel has ever acted in. Should be some awards for Mel, the Director, the Film, and also the supporting cast! Thank you again for the upload!
